Microsoft (R) Windows Script Host Version 5.8

---------------------------------------

is running within the valid grace period.
Last 5 characters of installed product key: H3GVB

---------------------------------------
---Exiting-----------------------------

For those who get the error message when installing: "Setup cannot find the required setup controller file. Either there was a network error, an error reading the CD, DVD, or other installation media, or a problem with the package you downloaded. "

It is very simple, change your default internet browser to internet explorer instead of firefox (go to internet explorer / tools / program / make default)... Then unmount the iso file with winrar in a folder, not on the desktop.... dont know why, but that helped me, and now i am running it nice...

To those of you who are concerned about windows not updating once you install office, if your running winows7, it should only take about 2 days for you to update it to SP1 which is the last of the updates as of today. Heck, if you make it a boot disc using image burn then remove office, update windows then re-install office. It's not that hard. But for sure, watch out for one of the downloads from Microsoft that says something like kbxxxxx [x's are numbers ok] then it will say something about checks for real software, you might want to uncheck that update. The person having a problem with updating stopping, this could be the problem, that one update.

Can someone PLEASE tell me how to download this program? (before any ISO or RAR program on my computer;. from scratch; step by step PLEASE!) I'm new at this but I learn quickly.

@kimkamera 
1) Download this and save it
2) You need Nero Burning ROM or Some CD/DVD burning software
3) Run Nero Burning ROM
4) Go to 'Recorder' in the Menu bar of Nero Burning ROM
5) Choose 'Burn Image'
6) A window pops out and you choose the ISO file of MS Office (this download)
7) Then click on 'Ok'
8) Burn it to CD or DVD
9) After successfully burning you can insert that CD or DVD and run MS office to install it on your PC

Hope this helps!
